thread.title: Game Time Set For USC-Texas A
thread.title_full: Game Time Set For USC-Texas A

title: Game Time Set For USC-Texas A
text:
Game Time Set For USC-Texas A&M Tools 
Story Created: Oct 19, 2015 at 4:17 PM   19, 2015 at 4:17 PM EDT COLUMBIA, S.C. (USC SID) -- The University of South Carolina football team will have a noon Eastern time (11 am local) kick when they travel to College Station for the first time in school history, to face the Texas A&M Aggies on Saturday, October 31.The game will be televised on either ESPN or the SEC Network. The network will be determined following games of October 24.Texas A&M defeated South Carolina by a 52-28 score last season in Columbia in the season opener for both schools. That marked the first meeting ever between these two universities that are now “permanent” opponents in the SEC schedule.Here are the television selections for Saturday, October 31:SEC Network* Noon ET Ole Miss at Auburn or South Carolina at Texas A&MESPN* Noon ET Ole Miss at Auburn or South Carolina at Texas A&MCBS 3:30 pm ET Georgia vs. FloridaSEC Network 4 pm UT Martin at ArkansasESPN2 or ESPNU* 7 pm Vanderbilt at HoustonSEC Network 7:30 pm Tennessee at Kentucky*Network will be decided following games of October 24. Times will not change.
